package contents¶

print or save a report of overall statistics and detailed statistics for a given dataset. It can be used as a standalone module as well.

datareport.print_report(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, prt_table_stats: bool = True, prt_var_summary: bool = True, prt_var_stats: bool = True, prt_conf_matrix: bool = True, sample_size: int = -1, var_per_row: int = 6, random_state: int = 0, report_file: str = '') → None¶

Print out descriptive analysis report for a given dataset.

Parameters

  • df – the target dataset

  • prt_table_stats – if print the table statistics

  • prt_var_summary – if print the variable summaries

  • prt_var_stats – if print the variables statistics

  • prt_conf_matrix – if print the confusion matrix for binary varilables

  • sample_size – Number of rows to sample from the target dataframe

  • var_per_row – number of columns of stats to print per row

  • random_state – Random seed for the row sampler

  • report_file – store the report to a file

Returns

None

datareport.get_var_summary(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, sample_size: int = -1, random_state: int = 0) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Provide a summary table of data types of the given dataset.

Parameters

  • df – the target dataset

  • sample_size – Number of rows to sample from the target dataframe

  • random_state – Random seed for the row sampler

Returns

a summary table of data types of the given dataset

datareport.get_variable_stats(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → Dict[str, List[pandas.core.series.Series]]¶

Collect statistics from each variable.

Parameters

df – the target dataset

Returns

a dictionary contains statistics of all variables

datareport.plot_time_series(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, col_list: list, datetime: str = '') → None¶
Parameters

  • df – input dataset

  • datetime – target date variable, leave it empty if it is the index

  • col_list – target columns

Returns
